title: The Writer's Almanac - Thursday, April 9, 2020
description: "The major trick to writing good historical fiction is not in compiling research or knowing the details, but in knowing which details to leave out." –Elizabeth Crook, born this day in 1959
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: "The major trick to writing good historical fiction is not in compiling research or knowing the details, but in knowing which details to leave out." –Elizabeth Crook, born this day in 1959
